persona.name: Riley Hart
persona.backstory: Runs operations at a 20-person startup. Always looking for productivity tools.

post.content: So, I'm literally on my 4th revision of this presentation and honestly, it's driving me nuts. I spent like 6 hours this week just trying to get the visuals looking decent, but every time I think I'm close, something goes off the rails. I swear, I just want to deliver a clear message, but the formatting is eating up all my time. Last Thursday, I had to present some updates to the team and my slides looked like a jumbled mess. Not the kind of vibe I was going for, ya know? It feels like I'm spending more time on making it look pretty than actually working on the content. Am I the only one who feels like presentations are just this endless cycle of tweaking and stressing? How do you guys handle this?
